snippet.title: Conflict After the Cold War: Arguments on Causes of War ...
snippet.description: Through the precision of its approach and attention to new issues, this book challenges conventional wisdom and encourages more critical examination of the political, economic, social, and military factors that underlie political violence.

snippet.title: The Causes of the Cold War
snippet.description: Explores the rivalry and tensions between the United States and the Soviet Union stemming from their differing ideologies and discusses the resulting events during the decade after World War II.

snippet.title: The Cambridge History of the Cold War \- Volume 1
snippet.description: This volume examines the origins and early years of the Cold War in the first comprehensive historical reexamination of the period.

snippet.title: The Cold War: Conflict in Europe and Asia
snippet.description: Indhold: The Cold War in Europa 1945-91; The Cold War in Asia and the amricas 1949-75; Cold War to Détente 1945-91; Containing communism: the USA in Asia 1945-73.

snippet.title: Cold War: Causes & Origins: Shmoop US History Guide
snippet.description: Shmoop is here to make you a better lover (of history) and to help you make connections to other historical moments, works of literature, current events, and pop culture. These learning guides will help you sink your teeth into the past.

snippet.title: Cold War Theories: World Polarization, 1943-1953 - Page 23
snippet.description: Two Interpretations and a Critique The Official Historians on Causes The official historians of the Cold War without exception have pointed to a causative relationship between communism and the Cold War. They have found that national ...

snippet.title: The Cold War and After: Prospects for Peace
snippet.description: This collection of essays combines the rare virtues of theoretical sophistication, comprehensive treatment of the subject, complementarity, and timeliness.

snippet.title: World War II and the Beginning of the Cold War \- Page 1
snippet.description: The Cold War Begins On 25 April 1945, during the last stages of the war in Europe, the first advanced detachments of the U.S. and the ... Not surprisingly, the causes and origins of the cold war became, and remain, a matter of bitter dispute.
